title: ValueError: all the input arrays must have same number of dimensions, but the array at index 0 has 1 dimension(s) and the array at index 1 has 2 dimension(s)
body:
I'm trying to use DeepExplainer with my deep model, which has multiple inputs (17). I have successfully instantiated it like this (pay no attention to the fact that background samples are not randomly selected):
```
background = [input_mode[:100] for input_mode in network_inputs_validation]
e = shap.DeepExplainer(model, background)
```
However, when I try to get the Shapley Values for a particular sample, I get this error:
```
test_input = [input_mode[101] for input_mode in network_inputs_validation]
shap_values = e.shap_values(test_input)
```

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-42-783b0780b4c5> in <module>()
      1 test_input = [input_mode[101] for input_mode in network_inputs_validation]
----> 2 shap_values = e.shap_values(test_input)

~/anaconda3/envs/tensorflow_p36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/__init__.py in shap_values(self, X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order)
    117         were chosen as "top".
    118         """
--> 119         return self.explainer.shap_values(X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order)

~/anaconda3/envs/tensorflow_p36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py in shap_values(self, X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order)
    262                 tiled_X = [np.tile(X[l][j:j+1], (bg_data[l].shape[0],) + tuple([1 for k in range(len(X[l].shape)-1)])) for l in range(len(X))]
    263                 # we use the first sample for the current sample and the rest for the references
--> 264                 joint_input = [np.concatenate([tiled_X[l], bg_data[l]], 0) for l in range(len(X))]
    265                 # run attribution computation graph
    266                 feature_ind = model_output_ranks[j,i]

~/anaconda3/envs/tensorflow_p36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py in <listcomp>(.0)
    262                 tiled_X = [np.tile(X[l][j:j+1], (bg_data[l].shape[0],) + tuple([1 for k in range(len(X[l].shape)-1)])) for l in range(len(X))]
    263                 # we use the first sample for the current sample and the rest for the references
--> 264                 joint_input = [np.concatenate([tiled_X[l], bg_data[l]], 0) for l in range(len(X))]
    265                 # run attribution computation graph
    266                 feature_ind = model_output_ranks[j,i]

<__array_function__ internals> in concatenate(*args, **kwargs)

ValueError: all the input arrays must have same number of dimensions, but the array at index 0 has 1 dimension(s) and the array at index 1 has 2 dimension(s)
```

Any ideas? BTW I'm using TF 2.0 in non-eager mode and the model was created using tf.keras.

Thanks.
